# Fatima al-Fihri

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

Fatima al-Fihre (El-Fihriya)  
---  
Native name|  فاطمة الفهرية  
Born|  c. 800  
[Kairouan](/wiki/Kairouan "Kairouan"), [Abbasid
Caliphate](/wiki/Abbasid_Caliphate "Abbasid Caliphate")  
Died|  880  
[Fes](/wiki/Fes "Fes"), [Idrisid dynasty](/wiki/Idrisid_dynasty "Idrisid
dynasty")  
Known for|  Founding oldest-surviving [madrasa](/wiki/Madrasa "Madrasa") and
university, [University of Al
Quaraouiyine](/wiki/University_of_Al_Quaraouiyine "University of Al
Quaraouiyine")  
  
**Fatima bint Muhammad Al-Fihriya Al-Qurashiya**
([Arabic](/wiki/Arabic_language "Arabic language"): فاطمة بنت محمد الفهرية
القرشية‎) was an [Arab](/wiki/Arab "Arab") [Muslim](/wiki/Muslim "Muslim")
woman who is credited for founding the oldest existing, continually operating
and first degree-awarding educational institution in the world, [The
University of Al Quaraouiyine](/wiki/University_of_Al_Quaraouiyine "University
of Al Quaraouiyine") in [Fes](/wiki/Fes "Fes"), Morocco in 859 CE.[1]

## Biography[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Fatima_al-Fihri&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Biography")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/University_of_Qarawiyyin_fountain.jpg/220px-
University_of_Qarawiyyin_fountain.jpg)](/wiki/File:University_of_Qarawiyyin_fountain.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:University_of_Qarawiyyin_fountain.jpg "Enlarge")

Karaouine Mosque and University.

Al-Fihri was the daughter of a wealthy merchant, and had been educated.[2] The
family was part of a large migration to Fes from the town of
[Kairouan](/wiki/Kairouan "Kairouan") (Qayrawan), in modern Tunisia, which
lent its name to the mosque and [madrassa](/wiki/Madrasa "Madrasa") she would
found.[3]

The madrasa Al-Fihri founded is still in operation today as [the University of
Al Quaraouiyine](/wiki/University_of_Al_Quaraouiyine "University of Al
Quaraouiyine"). It is the oldest continually operating educational institution
in the world and is sometimes referred to as the world's oldest university, by
being the first institution to award degrees indicative of different levels of
study. The mosque is also still in operation, and is one of the largest in
North Africa.[4][5][6]

The library Al-Fihri founded at the university is one of the world's oldest
libraries. The library underwent restoration and reopened to the public in May
2016.[7] The library's collection of over 4000 manuscripts includes a 9th-
century Qur'an and the earliest collection of hadiths.[8]

Mariam, Fatima's sister, was the sponsor of the Al-Andalus mosque, also in
Fes. Both were part of a larger tradition of women founding mosques.[9]
